abstract: Clyde Williams, former head of the Democratic National Committee under Pres Obama, is laying the groundwork for a possible race against Rep Charles B Rangel of New York; has commissioned a poll, met with major Democratic donors around the country and raised about $50,000 in campaign donations.
snippet: The former head of the Democratic National Committee under President Obama, Clyde Williams has raised nearly $50,000 for a race against Charles B. Rangel.
lead_paragraph: The former head of the Democratic National Committee under President Obama, Clyde Williams has raised nearly $50,000 for a race against Charles B. Rangel.

headline.main: Former Adviser to White House Is Likely to Seek Rangel’s Seat
headline.print_headline: Former Adviser To White House Is Likely to Seek Rangel’s Seat
headline.seo: Clyde Williams Likely to Challenge Rangel for Seat in House
